00001 #include <stdio.h>
00002 #include <stdlib.h>
00003 #include <string.h>
00004 #include <hdf.h>
00005 #include <HdfEosDef.h>
00006 #include <proj.h>
00007 #include "misrproj.h"
00008 #include "errormacros.h"

00010 #define MAXNDIM    10
00011 
00012 typedef struct {
00013   int  block;
00014   float line;
00015   float sample;
00016 } pts_t;
00017 
00018 int npts = 40;
00019 pts_t pts[] = { {   1,      -0.5,      -0.5 }, \
00020             {   1, -0.499999, -0.499999 }, \
00021             {   1,       0.0,       0.0 }, \
00022             {   1,       0.5,       0.5 }, \
00023             {   1,     127.0,     511.0 }, \
00024             {   1,     127.5,     511.5 }, \
00025             {   1,     511.0,    2047.0 }, \
00026             {   1,     511.5,    2047.5 }, \
00027             {   1,    101.97,     64.23 }, \
00028             {   1,     101.0,      64.0 }, \
00029                 {  65,      -0.5,      -0.5 }, \
00030             {  65, -0.499999, -0.499999 }, \
00031             {  65,       0.0,       0.0 }, \
00032             {  65,       0.5,       0.5 }, \
00033             {  65,     127.0,     511.0 }, \
00034             {  65,     127.5,     511.5 }, \
00035             {  65,     511.0,    2047.0 }, \
00036             {  65,     511.5,    2047.5 }, \
00037             {  65,    101.97,     64.23 }, \
00038             {  65,     101.0,      64.0 }, \
00039                 {  91,      -0.5,      -0.5 }, \
00040             {  91, -0.499999, -0.499999 }, \
00041             {  91,       0.0,       0.0 }, \
00042             {  91,       0.5,       0.5 }, \
00043             {  91,     127.0,     511.0 }, \
00044             {  91,     127.5,     511.5 }, \
00045             {  91,     511.0,    2047.0 }, \
00046             {  91,     511.5,    2047.5 }, \
00047             {  91,    101.97,     64.23 }, \
00048             {  91,     101.0,      64.0 }, \
00049                 { 180,      -0.5,      -0.5 }, \
00050             { 180, -0.499999, -0.499999 }, \
00051             { 180,       0.0,       0.0 }, \
00052             { 180,       0.5,       0.5 }, \
00053             { 180,     127.0,     511.0 }, \
00054             { 180,     127.5,     511.5 }, \
00055             { 180,     511.0,    2047.0 }, \
00056             { 180,     511.5,    2047.5 }, \
00057             { 180,    101.97,     64.23 }, \
00058             { 180,     101.0,      64.0 }, \
00059 };
00060 
00061 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00062 
00063   int32        fid = FAIL;
00064   int32        gid = FAIL;
00065   int          igrid, i;
00066   int32        ngrid;
00067   int32        nline, nsample;
00068   double       lat_r, lon_r;
00069   double       savelon_r1, savelon_r2;
00070   double       somx, somy;
00071   int          b;
00072   float        l, s;
00073   int32        strbufsize;
00074   char         *filepath;
00075   char         **gridname;
00076   char         *gridlist;
00077   float64      ulc[2], lrc[2];
00078   int32        spherecode, zonecode, projcode;
00079   float64      projparam[NPROJ];
00080   float32      offset[NOFFSET];
00081   long         iflg;
00082   int          status;
00083   char         diffflg;
00084   int32        ndim;
00085   int32        dim[MAXNDIM];
00086   char         dimlist[STRLEN];
00087   intn         hdfeos_status_code;
00088   void         *mem_status_code;
00089   long         (*for_trans[MAXPROJ+1])();
00090   long         (*inv_trans[MAXPROJ+1])();
00091 
00092   /* --------------- */
00093   /* Check arguments */
00094   /* --------------- */
00095 
00096   if (argc != 2) {
00097     fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s hdfeos_grid_file\n", argv[0]);
00098     exit(1);
00099   }
00100   filepath = argv[1];
00101 
00102   /* ---------------------------------------------------- */
00103   /* Inquire and allocate memory for the hdfeos gridnames */
00104   /* This is only require if you need the gridnames       */
00105   /* ---------------------------------------------------- */
00106 
00107   hdfeos_status_code = GDinqgrid(filepath, NULL, &strbufsize);
00108   HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDinqgrid");
00109 
00110   mem_status_code = gridlist = (char *)malloc(strbufsize+1);
00111   MEM_ERROR_CHECK("malloc");
00112 
00113   hdfeos_status_code = ngrid = GDinqgrid(filepath, gridlist, NULL);
00114   HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDinqgrid");
00115 
00116   mem_status_code = gridname = (char **)malloc(ngrid * sizeof(char *));
00117   MEM_ERROR_CHECK("malloc");
00118 
00119   gridname[0] = strtok(gridlist, ",");
00120   for (igrid = 1; igrid < ngrid; igrid++) gridname[igrid] = strtok(NULL,",");
00121 
00122   /* ------------------------- */
00123   /* Open the hdfeos grid file */
00124   /* ------------------------- */
00125 
00126   hdfeos_status_code = fid = GDopen(filepath, DFACC_READ);
00127   HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDopen");
00128 
00129   /* ---------------------------------------- */
00130   /* Loop through all the grids because I can */
00131   /* ---------------------------------------- */
00132 
00133   for (igrid = 0; igrid < ngrid; igrid++) {
00134 
00135     /* ---------------------------- */
00136     /* Attach to the grid of choice */
00137     /* ---------------------------- */
00138 
00139     hdfeos_status_code = gid = GDattach(fid, gridname[igrid]);
00140     HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDattach");
00141 
00142     /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00143     /* Inquire grid dimensions to check number of blocks               */
00144     /* Inquire grid info to get the number of lines/sample and ulc/lrc */
00145     /* Inquire SOM relative block offsets                              */
00146     /* Initialize misr block/line/sample projection routines           */
00147     /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00148 
00149     hdfeos_status_code = ndim = GDinqdims(gid, dimlist, dim);
00150     HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDinqdims");
00151 
00152     /* Block dimension is always last dimension returned by GDinqdims. */
00153     if (dim[ndim - 1] != NBLOCK) ERROR("File does not have 180 blocks");
00154 
00155     hdfeos_status_code = GDgridinfo(gid, &nline, &nsample, ulc, lrc);
00156     HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDgridinfo");
00157 
00158     hdfeos_status_code = GDblkSOMoffset(gid, offset, NOFFSET, "r");
00159     HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDblkSOMoffset");
00160 
00161     status = misr_init(NBLOCK, nline, nsample, offset, ulc, lrc);
00162     if (status) ERROR("misr_init");
00163 
00164     printf("\nFilename (path/orbit): %s\n", filepath);
00165     printf("Gridname: %s\n", gridname[igrid]);
00166     printf("Lines/Samples: (%d, %d)\n", nline, nsample);
00167     printf("ULC (x,y) (m): (%f, %f)\n", ulc[0], ulc[1]);
00168     printf("LRC (x,y) (m): (%f, %f)\n", lrc[0], lrc[1]);
00169     printf("Block offsets: (%f", offset[0]);
00170     for (i = 1; i < NOFFSET; i++) printf(", %f", offset[i]);
00171     printf(")\n");
00172 
00173     /* ------------------------------------------------------------ */
00174     /* Inquire grid projection info to get project codes/parameters */
00175     /* Initialize gctp SOM forward and inverse projection routines  */
00176     /* ------------------------------------------------------------ */
00177 
00178     hdfeos_status_code = GDprojinfo(gid, &projcode, &zonecode,
00179                     &spherecode, projparam);
00180     HDFEOS_ERROR_CHECK("GDprojinfo");
00181 
00182     for_init((long)projcode, (long)zonecode, (double*)projparam,
00183          (long)spherecode, NULL, NULL, &iflg, for_trans);
00184     if (iflg) ERROR("for_init");
00185 
00186     inv_init((long)projcode, (long)zonecode, (double*)projparam,
00187          (long)spherecode, NULL, NULL, &iflg, inv_trans);
00188     if (iflg) ERROR("inv_init");
00189 
00190     printf("GCTP projection code: %d\n", projcode);
00191     printf("GCTP zone code (not used for SOM): %d\n", zonecode);
00192     printf("GCTP sphere code: %d\n", spherecode);
00193     printf("GCTP projection parameters: (%f",projparam[0]);
00194     for (i = 1; i < NPROJ; i++) printf(", %f", projparam[i]);
00195     printf(")\n");
00196 
00197     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00198     /* Detach from the grid because we don't need it anymore in this example */
00199     /* We would need it if we go on to access fields, so don't detach here   */
00200     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00201 
00202     if (gid != FAIL) GDdetach(gid);
00203 
00204     /* ----------------------------------------- */
00205     /* Loop over some inverse transformations    */
00206     /* (b,l.l,s.s) -> (X,Y) -> (lat,lon)         */
00207     /* and over some forward transformations     */
00208     /* (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s)         */
00209     /* ----------------------------------------- */
00210 
00211     printf("    (blk,     line  ,    sample  )    "
00212            "(        SOM X    ,        SOM Y    )    "
00213        "(    Lat   ,     Lon   )\n");
00214 
00215     for (i = 0; i < npts; i++) {
00216 
00217       b = pts[i].block;
00218       l = pts[i].line;
00219       s = pts[i].sample;
00220 
00221       /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00222       /* Inverse transformation (b,l.l,s.s) -> (X,Y) -> (lat,lon) */
00223       /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00224 
00225       misrinv(b, l, s, &somx, &somy);      /* (b,l.l,s.s) -> (X,Y) */
00226       sominv(somx, somy, &lon_r, &lat_r);  /* (X,Y) -> (lat,lon) */
00227 
00228       printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) -> (%17.6f,%17.6f) -> "
00229              "(%10.6f,%11.6f) --|\n",
00230          i, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00231 
00232       /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00233       /* Forward transformation (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s) */
00234       /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00235 
00236       somfor(lon_r, lat_r, &somx, &somy);  /* (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) */
00237       misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);     /* (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s) */
00238 
00239       if (b != pts[i].block) diffflg = '*';
00240       else diffflg = ' ';
00241 
00242       printf("  %c (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) <- "
00243          "(%10.6f,%11.6f) <-|\n",
00244          diffflg, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00245 
00246       /* -------------------------------------------------- */
00247       /* Save the longitude of block 91 to find location of */
00248       /* equator crossing                   */
00249       /* -------------------------------------------------- */
00250 
00251       if (pts[i].block == 91 && 
00252       pts[i].line == 0.0 &&
00253       pts[i].sample == 0.0) {
00254     savelon_r1 = lon_r;
00255       }
00256       if (pts[i].block == 91 && 
00257       pts[i].line == (float)(nline-1) &&
00258       pts[i].sample == (float)(nsample-1)) {
00259     savelon_r2 = lon_r;
00260       }
00261     }
00262 
00263     /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00264     /* Determine block/line/sample of the equator crossing */
00265     /* approximately in the center of the block            */
00266     /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00267 
00268     lat_r = 0.0;
00269     if (savelon_r1 < 0.0 && savelon_r2 > 0.0 ||
00270     savelon_r1 > 0.0 && savelon_r2 < 0.0) {
00271       lon_r = (savelon_r1 - savelon_r2) / 2.0;
00272     } else {
00273       lon_r = (savelon_r1 + savelon_r2) / 2.0;
00274     }
00275 
00276     /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00277     /* Forward transformation (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s) */
00278     /* -------------------------------------------------------- */
00279 
00280     somfor(lon_r, lat_r, &somx, &somy);  /* (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) */
00281     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);     /* (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s) */
00282 
00283     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) <- "
00284        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = equator crossing\n",
00285        npts, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00286 
00287     /* -------------------------------------- */
00288     /* Extreme upper left corner (not center) */
00289     /* -------------------------------------- */
00290 
00291     somx = ulc[0];
00292     somy = lrc[1];         /* Notice the switch from ulc[1]. */
00293 
00294     sominv(somx, somy, &lon_r, &lat_r);
00295     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);
00296 
00297     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) -> "
00298        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = ulc of block 1\n",
00299        npts+1, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00300 
00301     /* ------------------- ------------------- */
00302     /* Extreme lower right corner (not center) */
00303     /* -------------------- ------------------ */
00304 
00305     somx = lrc[0];
00306     somy = ulc[1];         /* Notice the switch from lrc[1]. */
00307 
00308     sominv(somx, somy, &lon_r, &lat_r);
00309     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);
00310 
00311     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) -> "
00312        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = lrc of block 1\n",
00313        npts+2, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00314 
00315     /* -------------------------------------- */
00316     /* Origin of SOM projection for this path */
00317     /* -------------------------------------- */
00318 
00319     somx = 0.0;
00320     somy = 0.0;
00321 
00322     sominv(somx, somy, &lon_r, &lat_r);
00323     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);
00324 
00325     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) -> "
00326        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = SOM origin (long of asc node)\n",
00327        npts+3, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00328 
00329     /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00330     /* Origin of SOM projection plus 180 degrees longitude */
00331     /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00332 
00333     lat_r = 0.0;
00334     lon_r = (lon_r > 0.0 ? lon_r - (180.0*D2R) : lon_r + (180.0*D2R));
00335 
00336     somfor(lon_r, lat_r, &somx, &somy);
00337     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);
00338 
00339     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) <- "
00340        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = SOM origin plus 180 in long.\n",
00341        npts+4, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00342 
00343     /* --------------------------------------- */
00344     /* Equator crossing using SOM X from above */
00345     /* --------------------------------------- */
00346 
00347     somy = 0.0;
00348 
00349     sominv(somx, somy, &lon_r, &lat_r);
00350     misrfor(somx, somy, &b, &l, &s);
00351 
00352     printf("%2d: (%3d,%11.6f,%12.6f) <- (%17.6f,%17.6f) -> "
00353        "(%10.6f,%11.6f) = equator crossing\n",
00354        npts+5, b, l, s, somx, somy, lat_r * R2D, lon_r * R2D);
00355 
00356   }
00357 
00358   if (fid != FAIL) GDclose(fid);
00359   if (gridlist) free(gridlist);
00360   if (gridname) free(gridname);
00361 
00362   printf("\nNotes:\n\n"
00363 "1) Given a block, fractional line and fraction sample triplet the\n"
00364 "   following transformations performed:\n\n"
00365 "    Inverse transformation:     (b,l.l,s.s) -> (X,Y) -> (lat,lon) -|\n"
00366 "                            |--------------------------------------|\n"
00367 "    Forward transformation: |-> (lat,lon) -> (X,Y) -> (b,l.l,s.s)\n\n"
00368 "2) The transforms marked with a * did not reproduce the same\n"
00369 "   answer either because of rounding errors in the GCTP codes or because\n" 
00370 "   they are out of bounds of the particular grid.  The misr transform\n"
00371 "   routines (misr_init, misrfor and misrinv) are designed to handle out\n"
00372 "   of bounds conditions and return all -1's.  This enables a resampling\n"
00373 "   routine to determine whether resampling can be done or not, if these\n"
00374 "   routines are used for reprojection.\n\n"
00375 "3) Notice that the ULC Y/LRC Y values returned by gridinfo are incorrectly \n"
00376 "   switched when compared to transform number 0, 5 or 7 (depending\n"
00377 "   on resolution).\n\n"
00378 "4) Also note that the ULC/LRC values returned by gridinfo are for block 1\n"
00379 "   extreme pixel edges (not pixel centers).\n\n"
00380 "5) Note that SOM X is always increasing as blocks increase (in fact,\n"
00381 "   SOM X is zero meters at the longitude of the ascending node - the\n"
00382 "   5th parameter of projection paramters).  SOM Y tends to be mostly\n"
00383 "   positive in the Northern blocks and negative in the Southern blocks.\n"
00384 "   Each SOM path is a separate projection with the origin at the\n"
00385 "   night side equator and the longitude of the ascending node.\n\n"
00386 "6) The block offsets are the number of 1.1km subregions from the\n"
00387 "   previous block.  The first offset is relative first block.\n\n"
00388 "7) The 4th and 5th projection parameter are in the format of packed\n"
00389 "   dddmmmsss.ss as documented in the GCTP codes (see paksz.c).\n\n"
00390 "8) MISR uses the GCTP SOM projection A which specifies the inclination\n"
00391 "   angle and longitude of the ascending node instead of path number\n\n"
00392 "9) The last six transformations compute various special case locations.\n"
00393 "   Note the direction of the transform arrows.  Can you determine why the\n"
00394 "   lrc of block 1 is actually in block 2?  Hint: it is not the pixel\n"
00395 "   center, but rather the edge.\n\n"
00396 "10) Last note.  Remember that the SOM projection is singular at the poles\n"
00397 "    and thus undefined there.\n\n"
00398      );
00399   exit(0);
00400 }
